attributes.action: Revoke the knighthood awarded to Salman Rushdie in the recent Queen's Birthday Honours List.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the would like to express our deep dissatisfaction at the recent knighthood awarded to Mr Salman Rushdie in the recent Queen’s Birthday Honours list. Given the provocative nature of his work, in particular the Satanic Verses, we find it incomprehensible as to why such an award should be made to this individual.
The message being sent out to the Muslims across the world by the awarding of this title as well as its ramifications are more than clear. It is nothing but an insult, especially in the current climate where race relations are already tense. 
We fail to understand why Mr Blair has decided to further add fuel to the fire of his failing legacy and strongly urge you to revoke this decision.

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Revoke the knighthood awarded to Salman Rushdie in the recent Queen's Birthday Honours List."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can
view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page12867.asp

Prime Minister's Office
